body:
This PR is approved by @desaikomal. And it's ready to merge.
Final commit message: 
Fix helix-lock regression by changing the default lock priority to 0

Was able to fix TestInstanceAccessor.getAllInstances test.

Test failed: testCacheDataUpdates(org.apache.helix.metaclient.impl.zk.TestZkMetaClientCache) https://github.com/apache/helix/issues/2693 which is now fixed by https://github.com/apache/helix/pull/2705

Assuming that review looks good, this PR is ready to be merged.

Final Commit Message:
Fix WAGED to only use logicalId when computing baseline and centralize picking assignable instances in the cache.

Thank you so much for the review @xyuanlu!

This PR is ready to be merged.

Final Commit Message:
Fix WAGED to only use logicalId when computing baseline and centralize picking assignable instances in the cache.

body: Thanks for making the change. From my understanding, it only prints when there is a handoff failure, so wont flood log file right?

> Thanks for making the change. From my understanding, it only prints when there is a handoff failure, so wont flood log file right?

Yes thats correct. Also, it will print only once (and not for every pipeline run) as we are setting the state failed as true.
[link](https://github.com/apache/helix/blob/086215c378c6b3db33ad7ca7f29e15b706930062/helix-core/src/main/java/org/apache/helix/controller/stages/TopStateHandoffReportStage.java#L330 )

performed_via_github_app.name: GitHub Actions
performed_via_github_app.description: Automate your workflow from idea to production

body:
Pull request approved by @xyuanlu
Commit message: Fix Flaky Test testGenericBaseDataAccessorBuilder

CI passed except for testCacheDataUpdates which is a flaky test.

This PR is ready to be merged.

Final Commit Message:
Prevent the spectator routing table from containing SWAP_IN instances.

> btw what is CM in TestCM ??

CM stands for ClusterManager, there were two TestHelixTaskExecutors within the same module and had to rename the new Test class to this.

This PR is ready to be merged.

Final Commit Message:
Enable logging of critical unrecovered partitions during handoff within threshold.

Failed CI due to flaky test testDisconnectWhenConnectionBreak #2691

This PR is ready to be merged, thanks for the review.

Final commit message:
Change all rebalancer strategies to create Topology without additional non-FaultZone or EndNode levels of the tree.
Reopen the PR and remerge since last force push missed PR https://github.com/apache/helix/pull/2712.

This PR is ready to be merged.

Final Commit Message:
Stabilize TestInstanceOperation. clusterVerifier is evaluating to true once the partitionAssignment matches the expected value; however, it is before the TopState is transfered back to the SWAP_IN node. This can be fixed by using TestHelper.verify to check that states converge within TIMEOUT.

testZoneIsolationWithInstanceTag is flaky due to GlobalRebalance failing to produce best possible state. This is because cache is being modified by ReadClusterDataStage when GlobalRebalance is running in async. This is expected possible behavior. 

We will investigate way to mitigate this in the future.

body:
This PR is ready to be merged.

Final Commit Message:
We are improving the Helix Task processing to allow Helix to continue working on the failed Task in case of Throwables of type Error, and not only for type Exceptions. We are extending the scope from Exception to Throwable, to allow ZK state clean-up and retry code path to be executed on encountering java.lang.Error of any type as well.

body:
First and foremost, excellent debugging. QQ: After investigation, it was found that the offlineTimeMap was not being cleared by the cache and the BEST_POSSIBLE_STATE was not being persisted to ZK each time a new version was being computed by partial rebalance. Fixing these two issues ensures that the pipeline produces the correct finalMapping and the partitionAssignmentAPI is not using a stale BEST_POSSIBLE_STATE to compute the simulated finalMapping.

I understand the second part, very well.  You removed '_assignableDisabledInstanceSet' - how does it relate to the analysis?
for first part, the problem was happening only when we have certain hosts crossing over the delayed window? so essentially global pipeline gets updated, but partial pipeline is not persisted, so we get results are different?

Pull request approved by @desaikomal 
Commit message: Extend CustomizedStateProvider APIs

body:
This PR is ready to be merged.

Commit Message:
offlineTimeMap was not being cleared by the cache and the BEST_POSSIBLE_STATE was not being persisted to ZK each time a new version was being computed by partial rebalance. Fixing these two issues ensures that the pipeline produces the correct finalMapping and the partitionAssignmentAPI is not using a stale BEST_POSSIBLE_STATE to compute the simulated finalMapping.
